Description: Fragment of shoulder of North Ionian black-figured pottery dinos or krater; inside reserved; outside glazed with incised lotus bud and flower frieze, with added red and white detail.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Probably from same vase as British Museum 1926,1117.3 and 1965,0930495.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 225, no. 120)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 116, pl. XXXVI, no. 328.3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.922)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4707 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
